newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony unit sees no major impact from software delay.
newsitem.headline: Sony unit sees no major impact from software delay.

text.p: Sony Computer Entertainment Inc, a subsidiary of Sony Corp, said on Friday that a delay in the launch of Square Co Ltd's new software for one of its game machines would not affect sales of the machine.
"It will not affect our business," a Sony Computer spokesman said.
Square earlier on Friday announced that it would postpone the launch of a new version of its game software "Final Fantasy" to January 31 from the originally planned December.
The new game software is for Sony Computer's game machine PlayStation.
Although "Final Fantasy" will not be available for the busy Christmas shopping season, other game software for Playstation is available, the Sony Computer spokesman said.
Demand for PlayStation is rising and Sony Computer is increasing output of the game machine, the spokesman said.
